BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: FOUNDATION FOR JUNIOR ACHIEVEMENT OF ARIZONA INC

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Foundation for Junior Achievement of Arizona's mission is to support Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Foundation for Junior Achievement of Arizona's mission is to support Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc.
IRS990.Desc: To receive, invest, administer and disburse funds for the benefit of participants and programs of Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: At their February 20, 2018 meeting, the Steven G Mihaylo Junior Achievement Foundation Trustees voted to dissolve the Steven G Mihaylo Junior Achievement Foundation as a separate entity and move all of its assets to the Foundation for Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc. The investments were sold and all assets, $267,065, were transferred to the accounts of the Foundation for Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc. on March 9, 2018. These funds are included in the contributions amount on Form 990, Part VII, Line 1f and on Schedule D, Part V, Line 1b. The assets, $148,700 of which is permanently endowed, will be maintained within the Foundation for Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc. and administered by its Trustees.
The endowment funds are to be used to support the programs of Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc.

The Organization is exempt from federal and state income taxes under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code and Section 43-1201(4) of the Arizona Revised Statutes. However, the Organization remains subject to income taxes on any net income that is derived from a trade or business, regularly carried on and not in furtherance of the purpose for which it was granted exemption. The Organization utilizes the provisions of FASC 740-10, which prescribes a recognition threshold and measurement process for financial statement recognition and measurement of a tax position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return. Based on the Organization's evaluation of the June 30, 2015 through 2017 income tax returns and positions expected to be taken in the June 30, 2018 income tax returns, the Organization did not engage in activities or take uncertain tax positions that would jeopardize its tax-exempt status, or generate unrelated business income, which would be subject to taxation. In the event the Organization is assessed interest or penalties by major tax jurisdictions, it will be included in the provision for income taxes in the combined financial statements.
Revenues of related organizations, net of eliminations.
Expenses of related organizations, net of eliminations.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: To provide support for the programs of Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization has a Board of Trustees made up of independent members who decide how much to distribute to Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc., the supported organization. Most funds support general programs, however some are designated for scholarship recipients. Additionally, there are restricted endowments, the earnings on which support general programs and a scholarship recipient. The general program support is transferred within the related accounts of this organization and its supported organization. The scholarship funds are also transferred to the supported organization where they wait until a recipient is selected. In the Fall, scholarship applications are emailed to all of JA's partnering high school teachers and the link is included on our JA website. Students have the fall and spring semester up until the specified April deadline to submit all mandatory documentation. After the April deadline, a scholarship committee is selected to review all applications and essays utilizing the scoring matrix provided. The top three candidates are then selected and the winning applicants are notified via email. Select winners must provide all required paperwork prior to the funds being paid out to the schools they are attending. The supporting organization then disburses the funds in accordance with the recipient's instructions. Disbursements for general program support are monitored for receipt by Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc. and used where needed to provide programs to K-12 students.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Foundation for Junior Achievement of Arizona does not have its own committee for reviewing the Form 990. The Finance and Audit Committees along with the President and Controller of Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc., the supported organization, perform the review. Upon agreement by this group, which includes two foundation trustees, the Form 990 is distributed to the foundation's trustees prior to submission to the IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Foundation for Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc. uses the written policy of its supported organization, Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc. The entire Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc. staff and governing board are annually given a copy of the conflict of interest policy to review and sign. The President meets annually with Directors to identify any potential conflict. Conflicts, should there be any, are addressed on a case by case basis. If a conflict arises, the individual involved must provide a solution as to how the conflict will be resolved. Compliance issues regarding employees are referred to the President. Compliance issues regarding the President are referred to the Board Chair. Compliance issues regarding board members are referred to the President and the Board Chair. Compliance issues regarding Board Chairs or any unresolved issues are referred to Junior Achievement USA Vice President of Employment and Employee Relations or his/her designee.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Foundation for Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc. makes its financial statements available to the public upon request. The Foundation does not normally make its governing documents available to the public.

At their February 20, 2018 meeting, the Steven G Mihaylo Junior Achievement Foundation Trustees voted to dissolve the Steven G Mihaylo Junior Achievement Foundation as a separate entity and move all of its assets to the Foundation for Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc. The investments were sold and all assets, $267,065, were transferred to the accounts of the Foundation for Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc. on March 9, 2018. These funds are included in the contributions amount on Form 990, Part VII, Line 1f and on Schedule D, Part V, Line 1b. The assets, $148,700 of which is permanently endowed, will be maintained within the Foundation for Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc. and administered by its Trustees.

DisregardedEntityName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Steven G Mihaylo Junior Achievement Foundation

TransactionsRelatedOrgGrp.MethodOfAmountDeterminationTxt: Determined by the Trustees based on 4% of a 3 year rolling average of the unrestricted corpus for $22,486. In addition the Trustees forgave the balance of a loan of $210,000.
Balance of existing loan at year end and verified with Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc.. See Part VII Supplemental Information for loan details.
The Foundation for Junior Achievement of Arizona uses the facilities of Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc. for its board of trustees meetings

The Foundation for Junior Achievement of Arizona has no employees. All accounting and miscellaneous services are provided by employees of Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc.. Reimbursement is based on time spent on foundation activities per employee.

Filing Fee of Arizona Corporation Commission annual report and filing fee for the Form 990 and fee for an electronic Form 990 questionnaire is paid by Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc., and then reimbursed by The Foundation for Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc. Estimated incremental value of audit fees and general administrative fees paid for by Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc. are reimbursed.
5% interest rate on outstanding balance of the operating loan, paid monthly

OtherOrganizationName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: Steven G Mihaylo Junior Achievement Foundation

TransactionsRelatedOrgGrp.MethodOfAmountDeterminationTxt: Historically, there have been two separate Foundations supporting Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc. the Foundation for Junior Achievement of Arizona Inc and the Steven G Mihaylo Junior Achievement Foundation. In February 2018 the Steven G Mihaylo Junior Achievement Foundation Board of Trustees voted to dissolve the Steven G Mihaylo Junior Achievement Foundation and transfer its assets to the Foundation for Junior Achievement of Arizona, Inc. where it will be maintained as a unique endowment. The fund balance that was transferred as a result was $267,065.

ReasonableCauseExplanation.ExplanationTxt: The information for the completion of the form 990 was still being gathered. Form 8868 was submitted.
